column4: ATIProblem:you install restricted modules, add several lines to xorg.conf and that's it
mhm... i need to install newest ati driver, you can help me or not?
why would you need to install drivers outside of repository? the latest drivers are already in rep
yeah right... repos :D apt-get install blablabla, is that installation method good? or that one in the forum better? btw. sry for my english :]
installing drivers from website is good in case drivers in rep are outdated
you have to install linux-restricted-[version of your kernel]
emm... maybe u can help install drivers? i hawe fresh ubuntu linux 5.10, installed about ~30minutes ago... :]
you have to install xorg-driver-fglrx, linux-restricted-modules-[version of your kernel]  and then edit xorg.conf
?? omg, it's like apt-get install xorg-driver-fglrx, then apt-get install linux-restricted-modules-[version of your kernel]  and then edit xorg.conf? that is workin` for ya?
[version of your kernel]  means you have to check the version of your kernel. type uname -r in terminal
last question... what i need to do in xorg.conf?
well, you have to either edit xorg.conf or use as root fglrxconfig
apt-get install xorg-driver-fglrx, apt-get install linux-restricted-modules-2.6.12-9-386, sudo fglrxconfig, restart and wola...?
of course if everything goes ok:) it's not also so,but I hope that you're a lucky person
if anything would go,wrong don't worry. it takes a moment to correct the config:)
did u install ati drivers for yourself in this style? like i will?? :}
